page.title: 05BEEF FARMING - HALTON
page.content: Mr. I. Clough has two bulls and 50 Pedigree Lincoln Red breeding cows, ages varying up to 12 years, after which they go to the slaughter house at Boston. Calves are born in November/December and are turned out to grass with their mothers during April. In October they are taken from their mothers and fattened in the crew sheds. They are each fed daily on good hay and about 4 kg. of balanced food consisting of rolled oats and barley, and a mixture of protein concentrates. At about 15 months old, when the calves weigh approximately 450 - 500 kg. live weight, most calves are sent to Skegness Meat Traders, while the best female calves are added to the breeding stock, and sometimes two bull calves are sold to other farmers for breeding.
